benchmark_details.name: Multimodal Instruction Dataset for Content Moderation
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces a novel dataset designed for content moderation tasks, incorporating images, videos, sounds, and text data to boost the performance of content moderation systems, particularly using large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance content moderation practices by providing a comprehensive dataset that allows for more accurate and efficient content moderation models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset lacks image diversity and may contain embedded biases. Limited access to computational resources poses challenges.

data.source: Aggregated from multiple publicly available sources for text, images, audio, and video content.
data.size: 558,958 text instruction-response pairs; 83,625 image instruction-response pairs
data.annotation: Generated responses using GPT-4 and GPT-4V, alongside manual classification.

methodology.calculation: The accuracy is gauged by the proportion of correct classifications of model outputs against expected outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better alignment of model responses with expected content moderation standards.
methodology.baseline_results: Mod-RWKV achieved 66.9% accuracy in text tasks; Mod-VisualRWKV achieved 84.8% accuracy in image tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using the ToxiGen dataset for text and NSFW images for image assessments.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Stringent security protocols implemented to prevent unauthorized data access.
